brief.title: Project Brief
brief.text: Our team was tasked with developing a prototype system prototype that seamlessly integrates physical and digital experiences for a future fully autonomous electric bicycle.

problem.title: The Problem
problem.text: Autonomous bikes are not yet available in the market and have the potential to revolutionize commuting. Building trust and ensuring transparency are crucial for the adoption of autonomous bike systems. In addition to these technological considerations, commuters are impacted by several shortcomings in the bicycle industry. Navigation systems often fail to align with how they plan routes based on familiarity, road safety, and traffic conditions. Cyclists frequently use their phones while riding for navigation and communication, causing distractions and posing significant safety risks. The clutter caused by mounting these devices to the handlebars can lead to suboptimal handling and reduce a rider’s ability to take swift actions in the event of an emergency.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.text: Our system is designed to facilitate an efficient commute by optimizing navigation and displaying important notifications directly on the bike’s dashboard. To reduce cognitive load, we integrated essential features into a single screen, eliminating the need for multiple devices while riding. Riders can select route preferences in the accompanying phone app, tailoring their navigation to their priorities. The app also allows users to provide feedback, enhancing future routing accuracy. When connected to the bike, the display shows important phone notifications, which users can respond to via voice control. Our design prioritizes simplicity to minimize distractions, enabling riders to start their journey quickly and stay safe throughout their commute.

details.title: Simplified Home Screen
details.contribution: The screen was placed on the lower part of the bicycle stem to avoid obstructing the rider’s view. Critical information such as speed, battery status, and autonomous status is prioritized in the top bar for easy skimming. Based on feedback about complex e-bike controls, we simplified the home screen to reduce cognitive load. The home screen features three key tabs: Home for speed and bike stats, Map for navigation, and Music. Additionally, a shortcut for voice control is included. The display can be operated via touchscreen or a trackpad interface near the rider's thumb on the handlebars for intuitive control.

details.title: Autonomy Spectrum
details.contribution: The bike is designed to keep users in control, even when in fully autonomous mode. To achieve this, we defined autonomy across individual spectrums for acceleration, steering, and braking. This means the autonomous system can adjust its influence based on user input, allowing riders to override specific aspects of the bike’s operation at any time. For example, if a user steers away from the autonomous path, the bike will still manage acceleration and braking, adjusting accordingly.

details.title: Speed Control And Autopilot
details.contribution: The bike offers two modes: "Smart Speed Control" and "Autopilot." In "Smart Speed Control," similar to smart cruise control in cars, the bike autonomously handles acceleration and braking to ensure rider safety, while the rider controls the steering. "Autopilot" is a fully autonomous mode where the bike manages acceleration, braking, and steering, available only when a destination is set, reducing navigation risks and improving system predictability.

details.title: Smartphone Integration
details.contribution: In the app, users can provide feedback on their routes, and paths from riders with similar preferences are aggregated to optimize recommendations. The phone can be connected via USB or Bluetooth, with notifications displayed on the bike's screen, allowing voice command responses. Calendar events and text messages with addresses are temporarily added to starred locations for easy navigation. This approach ensured personalized, real-time route recommendations and enhanced user convenience and safety.

projects.name: Precision Agriculture for Vineyard Frost Protection
projects.tagLine: Harnessing technology to provide small-scale vineyards with an affordable, efficient solution for early frost detection, enhancing crop protection and economic sustainability.

brief.title: Project Brief
brief.text: Precision agriculture is a growing trend where monitoring and automation is utilized to enhance yields and minimize financial risks. My team was tasked with creating a solution tailored for a local Virginia vineyard facing challenges with frost. Our client had previously experienced a substantial loss when more than 50% of a year’s harvest was damaged by frost. Frost countermeasures are commonly used but are costly and require advanced notice to determine when to deploy them. The solution is a reliable and cost-effective sensor network to detect early frost conditions for frost prevention in small-scale vineyards to help better inform when and where to deploy frost countermeasures.

problem.title: The Problem
problem.text: Frost in vineyards poses significant risk of drastically reduced grape yields. This issue is critically important for small vineyard owners, particularly in the Shenandoah Valley, where frost can lead to substantial financial losses and affect crop quality. Precision agriculture techniques can be utilized to optimize the deployment of these countermeasures, but existing frost monitoring systems are often too expensive for small-scale operations, highlighting the need for a more affordable solution.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.text: Our solution is a network of sensors capable of monitoring temperature variations and predicting the future risk of frost, offering an early detection system for frost conditions. Crucially, this system was designed to be significantly more cost-effective than existing solutions, making it accessible to small vineyard owners and addressing the financial constraints often faced in implementing advanced agricultural technology.

details.title: System Hardware
details.contribution: Designing and assembling the hardware for the sensor system. This included selecting appropriate sensors, creating a durable and weather-resistant design, and ensuring the system's operational efficiency in various environmental conditions.

details.title: Sensor Processing
details.contribution: Software for data acquisition and management. This software was responsible for collecting data from the sensors, processing it, and presenting it in a user-friendly format for vineyard managers to make informed decisions.

details.title: Data Pipeline
details.contribution: Integrating the sensor system with a backend server. This involved establishing reliable communication between the sensors and the server, ensuring seamless data transfer.

projects.name: Bumble BeeThere
projects.tagLine: A new location based paradigm for Bumble's app.

brief.title: Project Brief
brief.text: This project aims to grow Bumble's paying subscriber base with improved location services across mobile, desktop, and watch devices, focusing on the under-35 demographic. Leveraging precise location technology, it aims to enhance the experience for premium subscribers, particularly on the native iPhone app due to its high user concentration.

problem.title: The Idea
problem.text: By reminding users of their dates and informing them about potential delays or no-shows, Bumble BeeThere enhances accountability, saves time, and sets realistic expectations, reinvigorating user interest and trust in location-based features for the long term in the ever-evolving landscape of online dating.

details.title: Date Scheduling
details.contribution: Bumble BeeThere streamlines the dating experience by smartly integrating a scheduling feature within the app. When users agree to a date, a button appears, inviting them to add the event to their Bumble Calendar. This efficient tool takes the hassle out of date management, ensuring that agreed-upon meetups are effortlessly tracked and organized, within the familiar environment of the Bumble app.

details.title: Reliability Rating
details.contribution: Bumble BeeThere introduces a Reliability Rating feature, adding an extra layer of honest transparency to the dating experience. This 1-5 scale on user profiles indicates their likelihood of showing up to a date, with the score adjusting based on their punctuality and attendance history. Users who consistently honor their commitments see their scores rise, enhancing their appeal for future dates. This system not only rewards reliability but also empowers users to make informed decisions, fostering a more trustworthy and dependable dating community.

details.title: Watch Integration
details.contribution: Bumble BeeThere seamlessly integrates with the Apple Watch, using location technology to detect when users are en route to their date. This smart feature prompts the wearer to confirm their departure, celebrating timely confirmations. Upon confirmation, it promptly informs the other party of the user's status, fostering a culture of punctuality and clear communication. This integration not only enhances user convenience but also adds a layer of reassurance, keeping both parties informed and connected every step of the way.

projects.name: OpenAI Powered Murder Mystery Game
projects.tagLine: Dynamically generating game scenarios and character responses via Open AI.

brief.title: Project Brief
brief.text: This project was a personal experiment with OpenAI where I created a text based murder mystery game.

problem.title: Overview
problem.text: This game utilizes dynamically generated themes, plotlines and characters. Players are tasked with determining who commited the murder by interogating characters. Character responses are automatically generated based on their profile and the game story.

problem.title: The Idea

solution.title: Approach
solution.text: For the first week or so I primarily focused on idea generation. With such a wide solution space, I was able to spend time getting crazy with ideas. Initially I had a lot of trouble generating ideas that I felt had novel and tangible benefits. I really enjoyed this idea generation process, discussing with other students was extremely beneficially in helping me think about the problem more deeply. Once I converged on this idea, I began iterating on the user flow. This helped me answer a lot of questions I had about how this this feature would actually work. These flows helped me create a framework for the phone screens I would generate. One thing that I had not originally considered was the integration of the Apple Watch. Initially I restricted the process of confirming or cancelling a date to the phone app. A big improvement that this project underwent was pulling this functionality out of the app to help create a less disruptive experience.

details.title: Language of Date Confirmation and Cancelation
details.text: I spent considerable time deliberating on how to phrase the feedback a user receives upon cancelling a date. My aim was to subtly incentivize users to commit to the dates they arranged. After much thought, I chose to describe cancelling as bailing. This term strikes a balance, subtly implying that cancelling is generally unfavorable without being overly dramatic. For instance, I had initially considered using termination to describe the act of cancelling, but this felt excessively harsh. To further encourage commitment, I implemented a celebratory feature in both the phone app and the watch for when a user confirms a date. This addition serves as a positive reinforcement, promoting follow-through on planned dates. These carefully considered language choices and features were all part of a strategy to foster a sense of responsibility and enthusiasm about keeping commitments made through the app.

details.title: Keeping Date Planning Within Bumble
details.text: I decided to keep date planning, tracking, and management exclusively within the Bumble app, rather than integrating it with the device's system calendar. This choice was made to centralize crucial date details within the app, thereby maintaining user engagement. By housing key information about a date—such as the who, where, when, and what—solely in the Bumble app, the platform is positioned to play a significant and valuable role in an individual's dating life.To simplify the scheduling of new dates, I implemented a feature that activates when two users express a mutual intention to go on a date. This interaction triggers a button that enables users to automatically schedule a date in the app, with all relevant information pre-filled. This feature aims to streamline the date-planning process, making it more efficient and saving users time.

details.title: Simplifying the Date Calendar
details.text: The calendar feature was designed to present all the essential information about a user's scheduled dates in a clear and concise manner. Initially, I considered adopting an interface similar to Google Calendar, but I realized that it could become too cluttered and overwhelming. Incorporating such a detailed calendar format would also increase the number of steps required for a user to access specific information about a date. To address this, I designed cards representing each date with a focus on clearly displaying the most critical details – the who, the when, and the where. This approach allows users to quickly capture all the necessary information at a glance, streamlining the process of keeping track of their scheduled dates.

details.title: Moving Date Managment to the Wrist
details.text: The integration of the Apple Watch was designed to emulate the intuitive experience users have when the watch detects the start of an exercise session. In a similar vein, when the Bumble app infers that a user might be en route to a date's location, it sends a push notification to their Apple Watch. This notification prompts the user to confirm they are on their way. Initially, this functionality was confined to the phone app, but I later extended it to the watch to encourage prompt responses and reduce the steps needed to confirm attendance at a date. Upon confirmation by one user, the other party receives a notification as a reminder of their scheduled meeting. This feature ensures both parties are aware and prepared for their upcoming date, enhancing the overall experience of the app's scheduling function.
